questions.question_text: What three things does a workflow condition consist of?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A workflow condition in CrowdStrike or similar platforms is typically a logical rule used to define specific criteria for triggering actions. It consists of:

Parameter: The attribute or field being evaluated (e.g., host name, detection type, or severity).
Operator: The condition being applied (e.g., equals, contains, greater than).
Value: The specific value to be compared against the parameter using the operator.

Selected Answer: C
As Per the Documentation:
Falcon Management > Workflows (Falcon Fusion)
Title: Workflow conditions 
First paragraph:
A condition consists of a parameter, an operator, and a value. A workflow compares an observed parameter to the value based on the operator.

Selected Answer: C
Workflows are built around a trigger-condition-action model
The condition itself, would be defined in C.

Selected Answer: C
Answer C, checked on UI too
Answer B. Taken straight from documentation: "Workflows are built around a trigger-condition-action model"

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.

choices.C: A parameter, an operator, and a value
choices.D: A beginning, a middle, and an end

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. The >>UI<< audit trail report just covers things done by users through the consoles UI. API actions have a separate report called ""
D - Checked UI. We have separate report for API

choices.C: Audit records of actions taken by only APIs
choices.D: Audit records of actions taken by only users
choices.A: Audit records of Falcon instance billing
choices.B: Audit records of actions taken by both users and API clients

questions.question_text: Which user role will NOT enable the user to connect to a host using Real Time Response?
Which report lists counts of sensors in Reduced Functionality Mode (RFM) for all operating system types, and tracks how long a sensor version will be supported?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Checked in UI.
Host Setup and Management > Sensor Health

questions.question_text: What will happen to a host that is not part of any group which has a prevention policy assigned to it?

choices.C: The host will send a notification to the Falcon Administrator to assign a prevention policy
choices.D: The host will disable the falcon sensor
choices.B: The host will apply a sensor-based policy to prevent a majority of known threats
choices.A: The host will apply the default prevention policy

discussion.content:
correct is A. 
the Default is a catch all policy

Selected Answer: A
Documentation: Endpoint Security > Configuration > Detection and Prevention Policies > Title: Policy Precedence > para 4

If a host is not a part of any groups, or the groups it belongs to has no policies assigned, it is automatically assigned to the default policy.
